quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Tree and Mathematicians
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, issue, observations. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The General Grant tree in Kings Canyon National Park, USA, the only living object to be declared a National Shrine, is of what tree species?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giant Sequoia

questions.question: The irrational mathematical constant, Pi has its own architectural monument in London, which was decorated with William Shanks version of the first 700 decimal places in 1937.
Who was first to prove that beside an irrational number, pi is also transcendental number (i.e. is not a root to any polynomial equation with rational coefficients)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ferdinand von Lindemann

questions.question: The sequence of numbers, appearing within pis value has been an issue of interest for many professional mathematicians and math lovers. Such pi explorers have found that what occurs at decimal position 2440?

options.text: We reach the last decimal place to which our largest computers can calculate pi.
We reach the last decimal place where computer ENIAC calculated pi in 1949.
We reach the extent to which pi was known by 1750.
We get the first appearance of  666.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: We get the first appearance of  666.

questions.question: The baobab, a genus of trees typical for arid areas, is known to be used by Indigenous Australians as a source of water, food and medical remedy. In the 1890s however, a large, hollow baobab located near Derby, Western Australia was adapted for what usage?
In what famous math problem, first posed in the 18th century by a French mathematician, is pi involved?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buffons Needle Problem

questions.question: The mathematical constant Pi has an important role in calculating the period of a pendulum.
Excavations and research prove that pi was known as early as 20th century BC, when ancient Babylonian mathematicians used what value value for it?
In the city of Athens, Georgia, USA , there is a White Oak tree with more rights than any other tree.  What is so special about this tree?

options.text: Touching it is against the law.
It has the right to vote.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It owns itself.

questions.question: After years of calculations and observations of the results, mathematicians have found which of these statements about the mathematical constant pi to be true?

options.text: The digits of pi eventually reach a point where they repeat their pattern.
The digits of pi are equally distributed.
The number of 3s is larger than any other digit in pi.
The number of 5s is larger than any other digit in pi.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The digits of pi are equally distributed.

questions.question: The Diamond Tree, a giant Karri tree located south of Manjimup, Western Australia, has been of practical use to the natives since 1939, serving as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fire look-out platform

questions.question: Pi is an issue of interest for mathematicians and math lovers from all over the world. In Japanese, what does the expression En syu ritsu refer to?

options.text: Mitsubishis motto for the quest for finding better values of pi
The largest computer in Japan used for finding even greater values for pi
The Japanese term for an infinite number

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Japanese term for pi

questions.question: Mark the incorrect statement about sequoias, which are among the largest and oldest trees on the planet.

options.text: Sequoias can reach up to 150 m (490 ft) in height.
Sequoias can live for more than 2000 years.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sequoias can reach up to 150 m (490 ft) in height.

questions.question: Methuselah, a Great Basin Bristlecone tree located in the Inyo National Forest in California, is remarkable for what reason?

options.text: It is the most publicized living organism.
It is the tallest known living organism.
It is the oldest known living organism.
It is the largest living organism.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the oldest known living organism.

questions.question: The Bodhi tree, located near Bodh Gaya in India, is of great importance to the followers of Buddhism, because it is considered to be related to the spiritual teacher, Buddha, in what way?

options.text: God Vishnu spoke to him for the first time under this tree.
Buddha found enlightenment under this tree.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buddha found enlightenment under this tree.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Water and Following
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, line, amount. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which programming language is based on Horn clauses?
The halting problem computability theory was solved in what year?

options.text: It cannot be solved for all possible cases.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It cannot be solved for all possible cases.

questions.question: Water can be found in three main states on Earth. Which of the following is not one of them?
The irrational constant pi is not only popular in the math science, but also in science fiction. Which of these TV series has an episode, in which pi plays a significant role?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Star Trek

questions.question: Which of the following is not possible to happen to water in its different states?

options.text: Ice to sublimate into water vapor
Snow to sublimate into water vapor

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these are possible

questions.question: Which of these is not one of the state-changing processes through which water goes in nature?
What was the maximum amount of memory that could be installed on the 1975 PDP-11/70, one of the most powerful of the popular PDP-11 series, produced by Digital Equipment Corporation?
Which of effect of these is the main reason for the existence of the water cycle on Earth?

options.text: Thermal energy in the Earths core

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sun

questions.question: The program components named coroutines generalize the widely known subroutines by allowing multiple return values.
The water cycle is the continuous movement of water above and below the surface of the planet. What is this process also known as?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hydrologic cycle

questions.question: Evapotranspiration is a term connected to which of these groups?
Which line contains only types of precipitation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Graupel, sleet, snow, hail

questions.question: In what way is this popular sentence connected to the constant, pi: Sir, I send a rhyme excelling in sacred truth and rigid spelling.

options.text: The value of pi is encoded in the position of each letter in the alphabet.
It is a mnemonic device for the approximate value of pi.
It is the beginning of a long poem describing the history of pi.
It was written by Albert Einstein when he first discovered the irrationality of pi.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is a mnemonic device for the approximate value of pi.

questions.question: In 1936 Alan Turing described the a-machine (later renamed Turing Machine) as a device that can simulate the logic of a computer.
The fundamental book The C Programming Language was written in 1978 by BWK and what other computer scientist?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Water and Pollution
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, acidification, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many people die of air pollution around the world each year?
This defect of Earths atmosphere, caused by industrial pollution, lets more radiation reach the surface of our planet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ozone Hole

questions.question: This type of pollutant causes acidification of rivers, lakes and also damages tree foliage and degrades soil quality.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Acid rain

questions.question: What would be the Earth like without evaporation?
On which of these factors does the total amount of water on Earth at a certain moment depend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Pollution has damaged this great Chinese ancient attraction and it continues to disintegrate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Terracotta Warriors

questions.question: When burning fuel for energy, small particles are thrown into the air that are visible in the form of smoke.  It is called this type of pollution.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black carbon pollution

questions.question: What does a philologist study?
This pollutant causes inflammation of the lungs, impaired breathing, coughing, chest pain, nausea, and throat irritation and permanent damage to lung tissue in long term exposure.
The distribution of this substance into water is often deadly for seabirds as it destroys the structure of its feathers.  Thus cold water quickly reaches the skin and the bird often freezes to death.
Ice caps and glaciers are the second largest water reservoirs on Earth after oceans. What percent of the planet’s water do they hold?
Osteology is an important part of physical and forensic anthropology. What does an osteologist study?
Modern cars pollute much less than cars did in the 60s. Today, it takes this many modern cars to produce the same amount of air pollution as a car from the 60s.
The average temperature around the world has climbed during the previous century due to global warming by this much.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1 degree Fahrenheit

questions.question: This gas is produced mainly by automobiles. It hiders the bodys ability to carry oxygen in the blood, causing serious problems for people with cardiovascular diseases.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carbon monoxide

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Study and Father
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, condition, poe. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which ancient Greek historian is considered the Father of History?
Who is regarded as the Father of Mathematics?
Which of these is the study of knowledge?
Which is the correct pairing?

options.text: symbology - the study of percussion instruments

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: oneirology - the study of dreams

questions.question: Because of introducing a classification scheme for distinguishing living organisms, Carolus Linnaeus is known as the father of what field of science?
What does a cetologist study?
Which word means the study of drug action?
Myorrhexis is a very painful condition and can occur when you overexert. What is characteristic of this condition?

options.text: A vertebra is out of its joint or is dislocated
Rupture or tearing of a muscle.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rupture or tearing of a muscle.

questions.question: If you studied petrology, where would your interests lie?
What does an auxologist study?
This person is considered as the Father of Computer, as he invented a counting machine called The Difference Engine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Babbage

questions.question: Edgar Allan Poe is known to be the father of detective stories. What was he often characterized as?
Which of these is the study of Mars?
Which of these is the study of cells?
What is the medical term for a nosebleed?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Moon and Glands
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, stars, space. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Warm weather brings high pressure systems.
During  first quarter moon, what time does the moon rise?
What unit in the metric system do astronomers use to measure the wavelength of light?
The stars remain in the sky during the day.
What is the closest point to the sun in the Earths orbit called?
About how many lightning bolts strike the Earth each second?
During which lunar phase is the moon least visible?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waxing Crescent

questions.question: In order to be classified as a Category 5 hurricane, the storm must have what winds speeds?
The moon orbits eastward around the Earth.
This construction in the United States is struck by lightning around 500 times a year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Empire State Building

questions.question: Did Galileo Galilei invent the first telescope?
Who created the Fujita scale in the late 1960s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Theodore Fujita

questions.question: The endocrine system is made up of glands. Aden(o) means glands; adren(o) means the adrenal glands. What term means enlargement of the adrenal glands?
When was the Hubble Space Telescope put into orbit by the Space Shuttle?
During a new moon phase, is the moon visible?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Usa and Calories
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, summer, s. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the summer months, a clock located in Indianapolis, IN, USA will show a different time than a clock located in Paducah, KY.
You live in Ossining, NY, USA  and you call your friend in Honolulu, Hawaii. Its the month of May. How many hours time difference are there between these 2 locales?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6 Hours Difference

questions.question: A worker at a Riverboat Casino in Ohio near Cincinnati gets off the late shift at 12 Midnight, and arrives home in Indiana at Midnight. This worker lives about an hour away. Is this possible?
Hardees medium sized Strawberry Shake (Hand-dipped) is higher in fats and total calories than Wendys medium sized Frosty Dairy Dessert.
Subways 12-inch Cold Cut Combo Sub on white bread is higher in calories, fats and carbohydrates then Hardees Big Roast Beef.
A flight attendant lands at OHare Airport in Chicago, in the winter months, and drives to Gary, Indiana. Will he or she have to reset his/ her watch upon arrival in Gary?
Which of the following fast food items provides the consumer with the greatest amount of calories from fat?

options.text: Hardees 1/3 LB Mushroom and Swiss Thickburger

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dominos Garlic Sauce

questions.question: Youre crossing Hoover Dam from Nevada into Arizona (USA) during the Winter months (after Oct 31st).  Will you change Time Zones?
The state of Tennessee, USA has 2 Time Zones.
Which of the following fast food meals has the most calories?

options.text: McDonalds Chicken Selects Premium Breast Strips (10 pc)
Subways 12 inch Double Meat Classic Tuna Sub on white

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Subways 12 inch Double Meat Classic Tuna Sub on white

questions.question: Its the middle of July. You are in Louisville, KY, USA and you cross over the Ohio River into Jeffersonville, IN. You have effectively gone:

options.text: You have broken the time continuum

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Backwards in Time

questions.question: Referring to the previous question, if its 6:00 P.M. in Ossining, NY, what time is it in Honolulu, Hawaii?
Which of the following meals is the best source of fibers?

options.text: Arbys Market Fresh Ultimate BLT Wrap
Subway Chicken Bacon Ranch Wrap (with cheese)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arbys Market Fresh Ultimate BLT Wrap

questions.question: Blimpie’s Best 12-inch Sub on wheat is higher in total calories, carbohydrates, and fats than a McDonalds Big Mac.
Its your Birthday, and youre in Tokyo. Later that calendar day, you board a flight for Los Angeles. Will you be able to celebrate your birthday twice?
